unitName: Concept of Basic Electrical and Electronics Engineering

questions.explanation: Ohm’s law is V = I·R, relating voltage (V), current (I), and resistance (R).
Electric current is measured in amperes (A).
references: NEC syllabus AExE01: electric voltage current

questions.prompt: In a series circuit, which quantity remains the same through all components?
questions.explanation: In series, the same current flows through every element; voltages divide across elements.
references: NEC syllabus AExE01: Series and parallel electric circuits

questions.prompt: Kirchhoff’s Current Law (KCL) states that at a node:
choices: Sum of currents entering equals sum of currents leaving
Sum of voltages in a loop is zero
Power is conserved in a circuit element
Resistance is constant for all materials
questions.explanation: KCL is based on charge conservation at a junction (node).

questions.prompt: A bilateral circuit element behaves the same when its terminals are interchanged. Which element is bilateral?
questions.explanation: An ideal resistor is bilateral; its V–I relationship is the same in both directions.
references: NEC syllabus AExE01: bilateral and unilateral circuits
